fields.title: Corrison API Platform
fields.subtitle: Website Development at the Speed of Opportunity
fields.content:
I am excited to introduce Corrison, a Django-based eCommerce platform designed specifically with reusability and customisation in mind. It can be deployed across multiple domains while maintaining code consistency.

Corrison is a custom setup that uses Django on the back end to store and manage content—pages, blog posts, products and inventory. The front end, powered by Astro, turns that data into plain HTML/CSS files. Styles and components come from Tailwind CSS and Flowbite, all driven by simple config files where you pick your fonts, colours and layouts.
fields.hero_title: I’ve built a system that spins up custom sites fast!
fields.hero_subtitle: Astro Front. API Middle. Django Back End
fields.hero_content: Corrison makes use of a robust multi-layer architecture that powers its headless capabilities. Take a look at the architecture of the site. The diagram shows how the frontend Astro.js application connects to Django's powerful REST API endpoints, allowing for flexible content delivery across multiple platforms. This API-first approach ensures maximum performance while maintaining security and scalability. One Tool, Endless Websites.
fields.hero_right_content: Corrison makes launching and managing a website, blog or eCommerce store easy. Built using a solid foundation and powered by Astro on the front end, each site loads quickly and is designed with a mobile-first approach. Looking great on any device. I can swap colours, fonts, and layouts in minutes and spin up multiple branded sites in less than a day.
fields.middle_section_content: In my experience developing eCommerce solutions, I repeatedly encountered the same challenge: clients wanted similar functionality but with unique branding and customisation. The traditional approach of creating separate codebases for each project was time consuming. This led to the development of Corrison - a platform that provides enterprise-level eCommerce functionality while remaining flexible enough to adapt to different business needs. All I have to do is define what is needed in Django, run a build, and Astro creates a ready-to-serve static site.
fields.end_section_content:
